thread.title: High school football roundup
thread.title_full: High school football roundup - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: High school football roundup
text:
CLASS B
Ravena 33, Schalmont 28
Player of the game: Ravena receiver Logan Frangella hauled in four passes for 143 yards and three touchdowns, including the game winner.
Play of the game: Frangella gave the Indians the win with a 30-yard touchdown reception with only 48 seconds remaining in the final quarter.
Stat of the game: Ravena quarterback Brady Hughes completed 8 of 11 passes for 216 yards and three scores.
Notable: Schalmont receiver Zac O'Dell caught eight passes for 130 yards and two touchdowns. ... Sabres quarterback Jake Defayette threw for 156 yards and two scores and ran for 123 yards and another score. ... Ravena kept its perfect record intact and climbed to 7-0 with the win. ... Schalmont suffered its first loss of the year and falls to 6-1.
Johnstown 20, Broadalbin-Perth 13
Player of the game: Johnstown's Pete Wilson rushed 15 times for 155 yard for the Sir Bills.
Stat of the game: Johnstown quarterback Jack Fitzgerald rushed for 66 yards, scored a TD and threw for 124 yards.
Play of the game: Johnstown's Pete Wilson's 53-yard run led to a third-quarter score to keep Johnstown in front.
Turning point of the game: Johnstown's Fitzgerald came up with a sack in the fourth quarter.
Notable: Johnstown clinches a playoff spot with the win.
Schuylerville 54, Lansingburgh 14
Player of the game: Schuylerville running back Joseph Vanderhoof had nine carries for 175 yards and three touchdowns.
Play of the game: Vanderhoof's 59-yard touchdown run in the first quarter gave the Black Horses a 7-0 lead.
Stat of the game: Schuylerville piled up 485 yards of offense.
Ichabod Crane 28, Cohoes 14
Player of the game: Zach Herbst rushed for 247 yards and three scores to lead Ichabod Crane to the victory.
Stat of the game: Herbst averaged 19 yards per carry for the Riders.
Notable: Sean Daly had seven tackles to lead the defense and also hauled in a touchdown catch for Ichabod Crane. ... Tobi Zucco and Alden Bilinski had interceptions for the Riders.
CLASS AA
Bethlehem 14, Columbia 7
Player of the game: Bethlehem running back Ben Tietjen rushed 21 times for 129 yards and a touchdown.
Play of the game: With two minutes left in the game and Columbia driving, Chris Harvey intercepted Columbia quarterback Steve Lindemann to seal the win.
Stat of the game: Bethlehem had 245 rushing yards. Dylan Dubuque had 24 rushes for 115 yards to lead the Blue Devils' ground game.
Saratoga Springs 47, Ballston Spa 13
Player of the game: Saratoga's Dakota Harvey ran for 227 yards (on just 10 carries) and three touchdowns, as well as turning in a touchdown-saving tackle on defense.
Stat of the game: The teams combined for 544 rushing yards.
Play of the game: Late in the third period, Harvey turned a simple dive play into a 76-yard touchdown, breaking numerous tackles.
Turning point of the game: After Ballston Spa pulled within 14-7 midway through the second period, Saratoga's Brandon Hipsley grabbed a short kickoff, broke through a throng of tacklers and rambled 70 yards for a TD.
Notable: Saratoga closed the regular season with a 5-0 Empire Division record (7-0 overall) and will be, along with Shaker, one of the top co-seeds in the Class AA sectionals, which open next Friday. ... Ballston Spa (2-3, 3-4) finished fourth in the Empire Division and will travel to Shaker next week.
La Salle 15, Schenectady 6
Player of the game: Jack Field completed 7 of 15 passes for 137 yards and two TDs.
Play of the game: La Salle's Daniel Desharnais recovered an onside kick which set up the Cadets' second touchdown.
Notables: Tyler Harwood had 102 yards rushing for La Salle.
Shaker 56, Colonie 8
Players of the game: Shaker's offensive and defensive linemen dominated Colonie for most of the game. The offensive linemen opened up huge holes and allowed Shaker to rush for 381 yards and the defensive linemen held Colonie to only 137 yards of rushing for the game.
Turning point of the game: After struggling on its first offensive possession, Shaker scored on the first play from scrimmage the next time they had the ball on a 60-yard fullback dive by Ryan Duda .
Play of the game: Mikael Brown took the ball around the right end for a 90-yard rushing touchdown to close the third quarter and give Shaker a commanding 49-8 lead.
Stat of the game: Shaker had the ball for just more than three minutes in the first half and ran 14 plays, but managed to score three touchdowns.
CLASS A
Mohonasen 36, Averill Park 34
Player of the game: Ryan Deguire had a touchdown on a kick return and a rushing touchdown to lead Mohonasen.
Play of the game: Nate Stillson scored on a five-yard touchdown run with 1 minute, 40 seconds left to seal the victory for the Mighty Warriors.
Burnt Hills 47, Scotia 8
Player of the game: John Clayton connected on 8 of 10 passes for three touchdowns to lead Burnt Hills.
Play of the game: In the third quarter, on 4th and 15, Clayton lofted a pass to the corner of the end zone, where Jacob Shippey dove and hauled in the 22-yard touchdown strike.
Stat of the game: Rickey Woodley had 213 total yards of offense to lead Scotia.
Queensbury 40, Green Tech 0
Player of the game: Brett Rodriguez had 23 carries for 230 yards and five touchdowns to lead Queensbury.
Stat of the game: Queensbury rushed for 461 yards.
Notable: Patrick Conway added 153 yards and one touchdown on the ground for Queensbury. ... Green Tech lost three fumbles.
CLASS C
Corinth 61, Chatham 22
Player of the game: Kory Bennett rushed for 159 yards and two touchdowns on just nine carries to lead Corinth.
Notable: Corinth also got 140 yards from Alex Jenkins and finished with 470 yards rushing for the game.
Stillwater 37, Tamarac 7
Players of the game: Stillwater got a balanced rushing attack with 81 yards from Tyler Reyome and 80 yards each from Dan Morris and Jordan Rychik. All three also scored touchdowns.
Lake George 20, Taconic Hills 14
Player of the game: Lake George QB Nick Motta passed for a touchdown in the first overtime and ran for the game-winning score in the third overtime.
Play of the game: Lake George was facing a fourth and 26 when Motta connected with Brett Parsons on a 36-yard screen pass and a touchdown in the first overtime.
Greenwich 28, Hoosick Falls 18
Player of the game: Mike Brandow of Greenwich rushed 27 times for 155 yards and two TDs.
Play of the game: With Greenwich up 21-18 with three minutes left, Brandow broke a 44-yard run to set up his own TD two plays later to seal the win.
Mechanicville 33, Watervliet 14
Player of the game: Mark Debates had 29 carries for 257 yards and four touchdowns to lead Mechanicville.
CLASS D
Rensselaer 24, Canajoharie 20
Player of the game: Rensselaer quarterback Christopher Spath accounted for 194 yards of total offense with four TDs.
Play of the game: Quinton Foust's 40-yard touchdown reception early in the second quarter gave the Rams a 6-0 lead.
Stat of the game: Rensselaer's run defense held Canajoharie to minus 11 yards.
NONLEAGUE
Troy 50, Niskayuna 0
Player of the game: Damani Soares rushed for three touchdowns, two in the first quarter, and caught another to lead Troy.
Play of the game: Soares gave Troy a 21-0 lead with a 62-yard TD catch in the first quarter.
